Reference Text: <S ssid="1" sid="11">What if the production probabilities are estimated from data?</S><S ssid="1" sid="63">Therefore, when the corpus consists of yields only, we shall assume a priori a model free of null and unit productions, and study tightness for probabilities estimated under such a model.</S>
<S ssid="1" sid="17">We will show that in both cases the estimated probability is tight.</S>

<S ssid="1" sid="79">More generally, ~ will refer to the probability distribution on (possibly infinite) parse trees induced by the maximum-likelihood estimator.</S><S ssid="1" sid="32">The maximum-likelihood probability is tight.</S>
